Authors: Jos Houbraken, Jens C. Frisvad, Rob Samson
Title: Taxonomy of Penicillium citrinum and related species
Keywords:
Penicillium, citrinin, steckii, sizovae, citrinum,
taxonomy, section Citrina
Abstract:
Penicillium citrinum and related species have been
examined using the combination of partial tubulin, calmodulin and ITS
sequence data, extrolite patterns and phenotypic characters. From the
results can be concluded that seven species belong to the series
Citrina. Penicillium sizovae and Penicillium steckii are closely related
to P. citrinum, P. gorlenkoanum is revived, Penicillium hetheringtonii
sp. nov. and Penicillium tropicoides sp. nov. are described as new
species and the combination Penicillium tropicum is proposed.
Penicillium hetheringtonii is closely related to P. citrinum and differs
in having slightly broader stipes, metulae in verticils of 4 or more and
the production of an uncharacterized metabolite, tentatively named
PR1-x. Penicillium tropicoides resembles P. tropicum comb. nov., but
differs in the slow maturation of the cleistothecia, slower growth at 30
Â°C and the production of isochromantoxins. The type strain of P.
hetheringtonii sp. nov. is CBS 122392T (=IBT 29057T) and the type strain
of P. tropicoides sp. nov. is CBS 122410T (=IBT 29043T)
